acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 48 hours EC50=0.189mg/L of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data, 2004).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (dermal route) value of >5,000mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1977)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Based on the rat LC50 (inhalation route) value of 7.38mg/L (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (2005)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is a solid according to the GHS criteria and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 7,950mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1974)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: There was no evidence of treatment-related incidence of tumor formation observed in 2-year (rats) and 18-month (mice) carcinogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1978)).  Also due to the fact that the substance is classified as Category 3 by IARC (1987).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity is Category 1 and bio-accumulation is low (log Kow=0.62(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), since there was no rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 1%(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), it was classified into Category 1.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances with melting point of >55degC are not available (melting point: thermally decomposes at 185degC (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data)).

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Cannot be classified due to lack of data, though classified as flammable according to ICSC (2003). Assigned to Division 4.2 and Packing Group III (UN#2210 Maneb or Maneb Preparations with not less than 60% maneb, self-heating substance (ICSC (2003))) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods). The substance cannot be "Not classified" given the fact that it has subsidiary risks corresponding to Division 4.3 (substance which in contact with water emits flammable gases).

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on negative data in in vitro studies (reverse mutation tests, chromosome aberration tests and DNA repair tests) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1975, 1978, 1987)) and in vivo micronucleus tests on mouse bone marrow cells (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (2005)).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no chlorine, fluorine and oxygen

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data. Assigned to Division 4.2 and Packing Group III (UN#2210 Maneb or Maneb Preparations with not less than 60% maneb, self-heating substance (ICSC (2003))) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods). The substance cannot be "Not classified" given the fact that it has subsidiary risks corresponding to Division 4.3 (substance which in contact with water emits flammable gases).

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on no evidence of adverse effects on reproduction or offspring development observed in rat 2-generation reproduction studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1976)) and rabbit teratogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1989)).

self_heating_substances.hazard_statement: Self-heating in large quantities; may catch fire
self_heating_substances.rationale: Assigned to Division 4.2 and Packing Group III (UN#2210 Maneb or Maneb Preparations with not less than 60% maneb, self-heating substance (ICSC (2003))) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of conjunctival effects with a Draize score of 2.8 observed in rabbit eye irritation tests, which were reversed on day 8 (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1985)).

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of mild skin irritation observed in rabbit skin irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1970)).

skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
skin_sensitizer.rationale: Based on positive results in guinea pig skin sensitization studies employing the Maximization method (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (2005)).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_statement: In contact with water releases flammable gas
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The subsidiary risks of the substance fall into Division 4.3, Packing Group III (UN#2210 Maneb or Maneb Preparations with not less than 60% maneb, substance which in contact with water emits flammable gases (ICSC (2003))) under the UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods, which corresponds to Category 3 of GHS classification. Those containing stabilizers are also classified into Division 4.3, Packing Group III (UN#2968 Maneb or Maneb Preparations (Maneb stabilized against self-heating; substance which in contact with water emits flammable gases)) under the UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (thyroid, respiratory system, blood system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including increased thyroid weights, pathological changes in the thyroid gland, pulmonary hemorrhage, abnormal lung findings, decreases in RBC/Hb/hematocrit and increase in platelet count, red blood cell deformity, and hyperplasia of thyroid follicular cells (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1974, 2005)). These effects were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: In the available single dose toxicity studies in rats and mice, no clinical signs or symptoms referable to specific target organs were reported at dose levels below the guidance value ranges for Category 2 (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1974)), though some toxic effects were observed at higher doses.
